trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Waxahachie
There were no other sightings in Waxahachie on or around February 6th 2008
divs: Sighting DetailsTuesday, Feb. 6th, 2008: I first noticed bright flashes in the night sky about a mile after getting on to FM 813 traveling from Waxahachie to Palmer, a 9 mile stretch of fairly winding road. At first I thought they came from a nearby tower to warn aircraft, but then realized that they were both higher, brighter and moved across the sky in a rhythmic pattern in a 1-one-thousand, 2-one-thousand, 3-one-thousand time frame. The flashes tended to stay at the same asimuth, about 40-45 degrees up. Flash one was the brightest at 3 o'clock then slightly not as bright at 12 o'clock then less bright at about 9 O'clock. As I traveled these became more eratic and less rhythmic. About 3 miles outside of Palmer, I caught one flash that bounced right to my left as I looked out the window and my eyes caught an entire rainbow of color. This was the last flash. I saw no more that night. I got home shortly after 10 pm so this happened between 9:30 and 9:50 pm. I am a scientist, so therefore the flashes were a curiosity to me.
Summary: Flashes in sky on way home along country road 878
